sentences.en: After a long sleep,he still felt torpid.
sentences.cn: 长睡一觉后他仍然觉得有气无力。

sentences.en: And under the influence of that wintry piece of fact, she would become torpid again.
sentences.cn: 于是在凛冽如寒风一般的事实的影响之下, 她又回到蛰伏的状态之中.

sentences.en: Even when he was awake he was completely torpid.
sentences.cn: 他醒着的时候也完全麻木不动.

sentences.en: He just walked and his mind drifted slowly like a torpid stream.
sentences.cn: 他只是埋头走,脑袋里思想都凝滞了,有如一汪流不动的溪水.

sentences.en: Keep on idling like this, and you will surely become torpid.
sentences.cn: 如果你继续这样懒下去, 你的脑子一定会生锈的.

sentences.en: Over it all hangs the torpid sullen breeze of May.
sentences.cn: 但是无论哪里都躲不过那欲吹无力的五月的风.

sentences.en: The fervent heat merely communicated a genial warmth to their half - torpid systems.
sentences.cn: 炽热的温度对他们半麻痹的系统而言只能传达出一种亲切和温暖而已.

sentences.en: The two ships becalmed on a torpid sea, I believed to be marine phantoms.
sentences.cn: 两艘轮船停泊在水波不兴的海面上, 我以为它们是海上的鬼怪.

sentences.en: To pass the winter in a dormant or torpid state.
sentences.cn: 在蛰伏的或昏睡的状态中过冬.

words.tran_cn: 迟钝地；麻痹地；动物休眠地
不活泼；麻木；麻痹；无感觉
迟钝的，迟缓的；不活泼的；麻痹的；[生物]蛰伏的

trans.tran_cn: 麻痹的，懒散的，不活泼的，冬眠（中）的
trans.tran_en: not active because you are lazy or sleepy
